intro: Casearia richii, commonly known as the white casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its small white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. Casearia richii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
